oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Superplastic forming of zircaloy-2 pressure tube material
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: FOTEDAR, R
KISHORE, R
KASHYAP, BP
BANERJEE, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: superplastic forming
pressure tube
strain rate sensitivity index
crack
hydrostatic pressure
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Zircaloy, known to exhibit superplastic deformation in the temperature range of 800-850 degrees C, has been used for the forming of hemispherical domes. Conventional tensile test data was seen to satisfactorily predict the operating parameters in this alloy; these closely matched with that obtained by a simple bi-axial forming test. The cold work increases the formability and avoided apex cracking.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 1997 International Conference on Superplasticity in Advanced Materials (ICSAM-97),BANGALORE, INDIA,JAN 29-31, 1997
